p: Italy is the first country facing serious issues and a large number of deaths due to COVID-19 in Europe, followed by Spain, France, Germany, and the United Kingdom [ 5]. The main issue in all affected countries is that of the health systems’ capabilities and performance. Toward this direction and based on early Italian data about the spread of the disease, all European countries have taken measures aiming at “flattening the curve” [ 6], meaning to spread the cases—and, consequently, the patients that need to be admitted to the intensive care unit—over a longer period of time.
